chief.note: Commissioned as Consul General only and used the title Agent and Consul General with the acquiescence of the Department of State.
Commissioned as Consul General only and used the title Agent and Consul General with the acquiescence of the Department of State.

Commissioned as Consul General only and used the title Agent and Consul General with the acquiescence of the Department of State. Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on April 18, 1854, after confirmation.
Commissioned as Consul General only and used only his consular title.
Commissioned as Consul General only; not recommissioned when his title was changed to Agent and Consul General by Act of Congress approved on June 20, 1864.
Commissioned as Consul General only; used the title Agent and Consul General with the acquiescence of the Department of State.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 11, 1872, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on October 29, 1881, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 20, 1886, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; died in Venice on way home.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 8, 1892, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on August 25, 1893, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 13, 1899, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on November 24, 1903, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 15, 1905, after confirmation.

started.note: No record has been found of the date on which Howell was presented to the Sultan as Agent and Consul General.

ended.note: Promoted to Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 15, 1934, after confirmation.

ended.note: Promoted to Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 13, 1947, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on March 2, 1949, after confirmation.

ended.note: Recommissioned and reaccredited after formation of the United Arab Republic

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 29, 1957, after confirmation.
Commissioned to the United Arab Republic.
Commissioned to the United Arab Republic.
Commissioned to the United Arab Republic.
Commissioned to the United Arab Republic.

ended.note: The United Arab Republic broke relations with the United States

mission-note.text: On June 7, 1967, the United States established an Interests Section in the Spanish Embassy.
The Embassy in Cairo was reestablished on February 28, 1974, with Ambassador-designate Eilts in charge pending his nomination, commissioning, and presentation of his letter of credence.

chief.note: Declined appointment.

Commissioned to the United Arab Republic. Proceeded to post, but did not present credentials; left post on June 10, 1967, the United Arab Republic having severed diplomatic relations with the United States on June 6, 1967.
